page.title: 12CHURCH STRETTON MARKETS
page.content:
In {1671}a magnificent black and white building was built. It was built from timber and plaster. But it was sadly burnt down in {1839}.
Then in {1840} a second market hall was built. It was built from stone and brick. It was considerd ugly and unsafe, so they demolished it in{1958.
Today's present market is just an open space. It is used for a car park except {Thursdays}because that is market day. There are many stalls like: fish, cheese, bacon, eggs, home made pies, cakes, jam, sweets, household goods, vegetables, fruit and a few others.
